transportAdvice: The Galle Fort area is very walkable, making it easy to explore the historic district on foot. Public buses connect Galle to other towns along the coast, and three-wheelers (tuk-tuks) are widely available for short trips, with taxis also accessible for longer journeys.

weather.description: Dry and sunny with pleasant sea breezes, making it one of the best months to visit Galle.
Warm and largely dry with good beach conditions and clear skies.
Hot and mostly dry, though humidity begins to build toward the end of the month.
Pre-monsoon heat with increasing humidity and occasional afternoon showers.
The southwest monsoon arrives, bringing frequent heavy rain and rough seas along the coast.
Peak monsoon month with persistent rain and overcast skies; outdoor activities are limited.
Continued heavy monsoon rains make this a quieter period for tourism in Galle.
Monsoon rains persist, though brief dry spells can occur between downpours.
Rain begins to ease slightly toward the end of the month as the monsoon starts to withdraw.
Transitional month with decreasing rainfall and gradually improving conditions.
Weather improves noticeably as the monsoon retreats, with more sunny intervals returning.
Dry season returns with warm sunny days, making December an excellent time to visit.
